physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mrs. R demonstrated difficulty eating, becoming increasingly resistant and unable to swallow as her condition deteriorated. Eventually, a gastrostomy tube was placed after a diabetic hyperosmolar coma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial weight gain after feeding tube placement was undesirable, and her mental function continued to decline, leading to severe flexion contractures of arms and legs.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Described as vegetative with no purposeful responses of any kind.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed from wheelchair mobility to being almost entirely bedbound with significant loss of interaction.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Developed bedsores despite being moved regularly.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition worsened, leading to increased caregiving challenges and reduced ability to move or respond.
